subject: Psychology
title: Anger and Injustice
description: A quick, practical guide to Anger and Injustice.

hook.text: Someone cuts in line and your blood boils. Anger isn't about the line ‚Äî it's about fairness being violated.

buildup.text: Anger arises when we perceive a deliberate, unjust obstacle to our goals.

discovery.text: Physiologically, anger increases heart rate, blood flow to muscles, and testosterone ‚Äî preparing for action.

twist.text: Anger isn't always destructive. It motivates social justice movements and personal boundary-setting.

climax.text: The problem isn't feeling anger. It's acting on it without thinking. The pause between feeling and action is key.

punchline.text: Anger signals injustice. The response you choose is up to you.

quiz.question: What typically triggers anger?
options: A perceived unjust obstacle to our goals
